refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GstGLContext wraps an OpenGL context object in a uniform API. As a result of the limitation on OpenGL context, this object is not thread safe unless specified and must only be activated in a single thread.

refsect2.title: GstGLContextThreadFunc ()
refsect2.para: Represents a function to run in the GL thread with context and data

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new GstGLContext with the specified display

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a new GstGLContext

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_new_wrapped ()
refsect2.programlisting: GstGLContext * gst_gl_context_new_wrapped (GstGLDisplay *display, guintptr handle, GstGLPlatform context_type, GstGLAPI available_apis);
refsect2.para: Wraps an existing OpenGL context into a GstGLContext.
Note: The caller is responsible for ensuring that the OpenGL context represented by handle stays alive while the returned GstGLContext is active.

entry.para: a GstGLPlatform specifying the type of context in handle
a GstGLAPI containing the available OpenGL apis in handle

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a GstGLContext wrapping handle

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_create ()
refsect2.para: Creates an OpenGL context with the specified other_context as a context to share shareable OpenGL objects with. See the OpenGL specification for what is shared between OpenGL contexts.
If an error occurs, and error is not NULL, then error will contain details of the error and FALSE will be returned.

entry.para: a GstGLContext to share OpenGL objects with.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: whether the context could successfully be created

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_destroy ()
refsect2.para: Should only be called after gst_gl_context_create() has been successfully called for this context.

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_activate ()
refsect2.para: (De)activate the OpenGL context represented by this context .
In OpenGL terms, calls eglMakeCurrent or similar with this context and the currently set window. See gst_gl_context_set_window() for details.

entry.para: TRUE to activate, FALSE to deactivate

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: Whether the activation succeeded

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_default_get_proc_address ()
refsect2.para: A default implementation of the various GetProcAddress functions that looks for name in the OpenGL shared libraries or in the current process.

entry.para: then function to get the address of

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: an address pointing to name or NULL

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_get_proc_address ()
refsect2.para: Get a function pointer to a specified opengl function, name . If the the specific function does not exist, NULL is returned instead.
Platform specfic functions (names starting 'egl', 'glX', 'wgl', etc) can also be retrieved using this method.

Note: This function may return valid function pointers that may not be valid to call in context . The caller is responsible for ensuring that the returned function is a valid function to call in context by either checking the OpenGL API and version or for an appropriate OpenGL extension.

Note: On success, you need to cast the returned function pointer to the correct type to be able to call it correctly. On 32-bit Windows, this will include the GSTGLAPI identifier to use the correct calling convention. e.g. void (GSTGLAPI *PFN_glGetIntegerv) (GLenum name, GLint * ret)

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a function pointer or NULL

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_get_proc_address_with_platform ()
refsect2.programlisting: gpointer gst_gl_context_get_proc_address_with_platform (GstGLPlatform context_type, GstGLAPI gl_api, const gchar *name);
refsect2.para: Attempts to use the context_type specific GetProcAddress implementations to retreive name .

entry.para: the name of the function to retrieve

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: a function pointer for name , or NULL

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the currently set window.

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_set_window ()
refsect2.para: Set's the current window on context to window . The window can only be changed before gst_gl_context_create() has been called and the window is not already running.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: Whether the window was successfully updated

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_thread_add ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gst_gl_context_thread_add (GstGLContext *context, GstGLContextThreadFunc func, gpointer data);
refsect2.para: Execute func in the OpenGL thread of context with data

entry.para: user data to call func with.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GstGLDisplay associated with this context .

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_get_gl_api ()
refsect2.para: Get the currently enabled OpenGL api.
The currently available API may be limited by the GstGLDisplay in use and/or the GstGLWindow chosen.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the available OpenGL api

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_get_gl_context ()
refsect2.para: Gets the backing OpenGL context used by context .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The platform specific backing OpenGL context

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_get_gl_platform ()
refsect2.para: Gets the OpenGL platform that used by context .

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The platform specific backing OpenGL context

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_get_gl_platform_version ()
refsect2.para: Get the version of the OpenGL platform (GLX, EGL, etc) used. Only valid after a call to gst_gl_context_create_context().

entry.para: a GstGLPlatform specifying the type of context to retrieve

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The OpenGL context handle current in the calling thread or NULL

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_get_current_gl_api ()
refsect2.para: If an error occurs, major and minor are not modified and GST_GL_API_NONE is returned.

entry.para: the GstGLPlatform to retrieve the API for

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The version supported by the OpenGL context current in the calling thread or GST_GL_API_NONE

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: The GThread, context is current in or NULL.

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_can_share ()
refsect2.para: Note: This will always fail for two wrapped GstGLContext's

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: whether context and other_context are able to share OpenGL resources.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: Whether the GstGLContext has been shared with another GstGLContext

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_set_shared_with ()
refsect2.para: Will internally set context as shared with share

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_check_feature ()
refsect2.para: Check for an OpenGL feature being supported.
Note: Most features require that the context be created before it is possible to determine their existence and so will fail if that is not the case.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: Whether feature is supported by context

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_check_gl_version ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean gst_gl_context_check_gl_version (GstGLContext *context, GstGLAPI api, gint maj, gint min);

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: whether OpenGL context implements the required api and specified version.

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_get_gl_version ()
refsect2.para: Returns the OpenGL version implemented by context . See gst_gl_context_get_gl_api() for retreiving the OpenGL api implemented by context .

refsect2.title: gst_gl_context_fill_info ()
refsect2.para: Fills context 's info (version, extensions, vtable, etc) from the GL context in the current thread. Typically used with wrapped contexts to allow wrapped contexts to be used as regular GstGLContext's.

entry.para: a GError to fill on failure.

refsect3.title: Returns
refsect3.para: the GstGLContext active in the current thread or NULL.
